item.title: Ghost of Yotei Continues a Trend The Series Should Eventually Break
item.description:
Summary

  • Ghost of Yotei's story revolves around revenge, similar to its predecessor, Ghost of Tsushima.
  • The next Ghost game should explore new territory and avoid relying on revenge as a central motivator.
  • Future Ghost games could focus on political intrigue, redemption, and personal transformation, departing from revenge plots.

Ghost of Yotei has been drip-feeding players more information since its reveal last year, only recently offering up a much deeper look at its story than what has been disclosed so far. Until its most recent reveal, Ghost of Yotei 's story was simply known as one of "underdog vengeance," opening the door for speculation regarding how that revenge tale would unfold. Now, more specifics on Atsu's revenge arc in Ghost of Yotei help shed light on what may result in a very compelling narrative, though the series may want to go a different direction from here on out.

By and large, Ghost of Yotei continues a trend that Sucker Punch's Ghost series should consider breaking in the next game. Now two entries deep, the Ghost franchise has entertained the idea of someone seeking revenge twice now, although Ghost of Yotei seems to be a bit more reliant on that trope than its predecessor was. Regardless, attempting to do yet another revenge arc in the next game may feel a tad repetitive, even if that game is still at least five or six years away.

Ghost of Yotei's Revenge Arc Continues a Trend the Series Should Break Soon

Ghost of Yotei and Ghost of Tsushima Both Have Revenge at the Heart of Their Stories

Based on what has been revealed so far about Ghost of Yotei 's story, revenge is at its heart, just as it was in Ghost of Tsushima . After her homestead is raided and her family massacred by a group known as the "Yotei Six," Atsu makes it her goal to track down and eliminate each member of the group to exact her revenge. How exactly this plot will unfold remains a mystery, but Sucker Punch has confirmed that players will be allowed to kill each member of the Yotei Six in any order they wish.

To some extent, Ghost of Yotei 's non-linear narrative indicates that the Yotei Six may not be the primary antagonists in the game and are simply what's standing between Atsu and her true enemy.

Ghost of Tsushima 's story goes a similar route, though revenge isn't the central driving force in the traditional sense, as it seems to be in Ghost of Yotei . Jin Sakai starts off trying to rescue his uncle and defend Tsushima, but as he adopts the Ghost persona, he begins making more emotionally-driven decisions. Throughout Ghost of Tsushima 's story, there's a subtle undercurrent of revenge, not only against the Mongols who have invaded Tsushima Island, but also against the samurai ideals that are holding him captive to methods that he deems ineffective. As the story progresses, Jin's tactics grow increasingly ruthless, especially when he encounters those who betray the island and its inhabitants.

The Next Ghost Game Should Give the Protagonist a Different Motivator

With Ghost of Yotei now seemingly expounding on the concept of revenge by centralizing its role in the story, and Ghost of Tsushima having carried an undercurrent of revenge that influenced Jin's actions, the next game in the Ghost series would be remiss not to explore new territory. Revenge is an effective way to justify violence, especially from a traditional samurai, but attempting to use it once more in a future Ghost game might be a bit too repetitive. Instead, whoever the next protagonist ends up being needs an entirely different motivator.

Now two entries deep, the Ghost franchise has entertained the idea of someone seeking revenge twice now, although Ghost of Yotei seems to be a bit more reliant on that trope than its predecessor was.

Given how much shifted politically during Japan's feudal era, perhaps a future Ghost game might see its protagonist navigating political alliances and power structures. The Ghost persona could remain intact, but be applied to someone who is also diplomatic. A future game could also follow a protagonist who seeks redemption for past actions, with themes that emphasize guilt, forgiveness, and personal transformation. There are several routes Sucker Punch's Ghost franchise could go that don't include revenge as a motivator, and Ghost of Yotei might signal the time for it to begin exploring those routes.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s Most Important Fight Is Also Its Most Painful
item.description:
The following contains major spoilers for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 .

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has been making some massive waves since its release, with almost every aspect of the game garnering praise to some extent. However, while Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 certainly has a lot of things going for it in its gameplay, music, and worldbuilding, it arguably wouldn't be as successful as it is without such a gripping, emotional story. Set in a world where an annual apocalypse called the "Gommage" jeopardizes their existence, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 pulls players into a story where the characters face an ongoing threat brought about by an entity simply known as the "Paintress," whom they set out to stop once and for all.

This means that the majority of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's story builds up to one moment, where the game's main characters finally confront the Paintress in battle. While the story continues even after the battle, the fight with the Paintress represents a massive turning point in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's narrative, as it essentially concludes one story and begins another. The Paintress isn't a typical antagonist, though, and that much is revealed once players finally face her. As the fight with the Paintress comes to a close, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 pulls a fast one on players with a mechanical shift they likely never saw coming, and it helps give heart to the being the game's world once portrayed as heartless.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33's Paintress Fight Is Emotionally Devastating

Clair Obscur's Paintress Fight Takes an Emotional Turn Near Its End

The entirety of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's story is incredibly emotional, pulling on players' heartstrings at every possible chance with plot threads that are so gut-wrenching because they are so relatable. However, one of the game's most heartbreaking moments happens during the fight with the Paintress, particularly in her final phase. Once players whittle down the Paintress' health bar and trigger her final phase, her mechanics change drastically, to the point that players might wish to stop fighting her altogether.

The story continues after the fight with the Paintress, but since Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's narrative revolves around the Paintress, it makes the fight with her one of the game's most important encounters.

Rather than becoming even stronger during her final phase as most RPG bosses tend to do, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's Paintress admits to her defeat and begins healing the party rather than attacking them. Naturally, this mechanic is expected to tap into the psyche of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's players by potentially convincing them to give up and stop fighting. Unfortunately, not only is there no way to flee the fight, but no matter how long players don't attack the Paintress, they will eventually be forced to deliver a final blow and end the battle.

The Paintress Fight's Healing Mechanics Tell the Story of a Loving Mother

This ultimately accomplishes so much more than simply being a unique boss mechanic and instead effectively attaches the player to the character of the Paintress, who is actually a painted version of Verso's mother, Aline Dessendre. One of the biggest revelations of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's story is that Lumiere and the surrounding world are not real and have instead been painted onto a magical canvas by Aline, the Paintress, in an effort to preserve the memory of her son Verso, whom she lost to a devastating fire.

As a member of a special group of individuals known as "Painters," Aline can paint entire worlds onto a canvas and see them come to life within the canvas. In the case of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's Lumiere and the world that surrounds it, Aline painted it all to immortalize Verso after his passing and give her a way to be with him. This is why things shift so dramatically during the fight with the Paintress in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , as she eventually stops resisting and instead does whatever she can to keep the memory of her son and his companions alive by healing them.

Rather than becoming even stronger during her final phase as most RPG bosses tend to do, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's Paintress admits to her defeat and begins healing the party rather than attacking them.

In the end, the fight with the Paintress tells the story of a loving mother who has simply been unable to cope with the loss of her son. Rather than defend herself against the memory that she created within the canvas, she used every ounce of power left in her to try and keep that memory alive. It likely wasn't only for selfish reasons, however, and her sudden healing mechanics are also just Aline trying to show her love for her son. It's arguably one of the most tragic moments in RPG history, but it's just another sign of how Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has potentially changed the genre forever.

item.title: Overwatch 2: All Gundam Wing Crossover Collab Skins
item.description:
Overwatch 2 continues its trend of crossover collaborations, teaming up with beloved franchises from games, anime, and other areas of pop culture to provide limited-time in-game events. In Season 16, the crossover collaboration event has been paired up with none other than Gundam Wing , an iconic mecha anime.

Much like the previous series collaborations, including One Punch Man, Cowboy Bebop, My Hero Academia , and more, the OW2 x Gundam Wing crossover collab includes a new series of hero skins. If you're wondering which Overwatch characters have made the lineup and received a new Gundam -style cosmetic, here's an overview of all the Gundam Wing skins in Overwatch 2 .

All Overwatch 2 + Gundam Wing Crossover Collab Skins

Overwatch 2 's Season 16 kicked off on April 22, 2025, bringing with it a brand-new Competitive Season and Battle Pass, the Stadium gameplay mode, Freja, the new DPS hero, and more. In addition to all of this, OW2 has also launched its Season 16 crossover collab event, this time with Gundam Wing .

The Gundam Wing crossover went live in-game on April 29, 2025 , bringing a series of event challenges and cosmetics for eager fans to claim. To obtain your choice of Overwatch 2 x Gundam Wing skins, you will need to navigate to the in-game shop and make your purchase from the main page. Players can also choose between purchasing the mega bundle containing all hero skins and items for 5900 Overwatch Coins or purchasing their choice of hero bundle, containing one hero's Gundam skin and relevant items (highlight intro, emote, name cards etc.).

A complete list of every Overwatch 2 x Gundam Wing hero skin has been included below, complete with images to give you a sneak peek:

item.title: Verso Build Guide in Clair Obscur Expedition 33
item.description:
Verso is a decent character in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . Like any other character, Verso’s skills vary between an offensive and defensive approach to battle. He also has a variety of single-target and AoE attacks that help him play in most situations.

Compared to other characters, players might find Verso’s Rank gameplay a little underwhelming. He must hit and not get hit, and that’s basically his gimmick. However, he’s very different from the other characters, and there are more layers to his mechanics if players can find the best build for Verso in Expedition 33 .

Verso Build In Expedition 33

Considering there are multiple weapons for Verso that allow him to apply Burn on hits from multiple sources, on top of the many, many Luminas that buff Base Attacks and the Burn gameplay, players can build a really strong Verso build in Clair Obscur Expedition 33 . The main idea is to utilize Base Attack to maximize Burn on the target.

Best Weapons and Attributes

Rank

Weapon

Attributes Priority

Effect

1

Corpeso

  • Agility
  • Vitality
  • Luck
  • Defense
  • Might

  • Base Attack applies 2 Burn stacks per Rank.
  • +1 AP on Rank Up.
  • Increase Burn damage by 50% per Rank, up to 300% on Rank S.

2

Confuso

  • Agility
  • Vitality
  • Luck
  • Defense
  • Might

  • Light damage can Burn on Critical hits.
  • Apply 3 Burn instead of Mark.
  • Increase Burn damage by 50% per Rank, up to 300% on Rank S.

3

Danseso

  • Agility
  • Vitality
  • Luck
  • Defense
  • Might

  • Base attack gives 1 Perfection per Burn on target.
  • While Powerful, 20% chance to Burn on hit.
  • +1 AP on Rank Up.

Best Pictos and Luminas

Lumina

Cost

Effect

Burning Shots

3

20% chance to Burn on Free Aim shot.

Double Burn

30

On applying a Burn stack, apply a second one.

Healing Fire

10

Recover 25% Health when attacking a Burning target. Once per turn.

Painted Power

5

Damage can exceed 9,999.

Combo Attack I

10

Base Attack has 1 extra hit.

Combo Attack II

20

Base Attack has 1 extra hit.

Combo Attack III

30

Base Attack has 1 extra hit.

Cheater

40

Always play twice in a row.

Energising Attack I

10

+1 AP on Base Attack.

Best Skills

Skill

Effect

Burden

  • Removes all Status Effects from all allies and applies them to Verso.

Powerful (Verso)

  • Applies Powerful to 1-3 Allies, increasing damage they deal for 3 turns. Gives 0-2 Perfection.
  • A Rank: Duration increased to 5 turns.

Perfect Recovery

  • Recovers 50% Health and dispels Status Effects. Gives 0-2 Perfection.
  • C Rank: Increased heal to 100% Health.

Leadership

  • Reduces current Rank. Gives 2-4 AP to other allies.

Overload

  • Increases Rank to S and refills all AP, but sets self-Health to 1.

Steeled Strike

  • After 1 turn, deals extreme single target Physical damage. 13 hits. Interrupted if any damage is taken.
  • S Rank: Increase damage.

Strategy

In this Verso build in Expedition 33 , he’ll mostly focus on Base Attacks to heavily debuff enemies with Burn. Using Cheater alongside the multiple Combo Attack I Luminas allows Verso to land so many Base Attack hits on enemies, which will build a ton of Burn DoTs. The amount of Burn status on enemies has no limit, so the number could go above 500 DoTs, which will deal crazy damage at the start of the monster’s turn.

Of course, this Verso build doesn’t work without having a weapon that applies Burn on Base Attacks, since Verso doesn’t have any skill that applies Burn. Both Corpeso and Confuso are good options for this strategy as they will help install the Burn status alongside buffing its damage.

Additionally, players can equip a large amount of Luminas that synergize with Verso’s Base Attacks, such as Attack Lifesteal , Charging Attack , Empowering Attack , Energising Attack I , Exposing Attack , and much more. These Luminas will greatly improve Verso’s role and expand it.

Since Verso is going to be using his Base Attacks most of the time, it’s better to build him with skills that ensure his survivability, such as Perfect Recovery and From Fire (Verso) . Players can also increase Verso’s utility by adding support skills like Burden , Powerful (Verso) , and Leadership .

Additionally, since Verso is going to hit enemies with a lot of multiple Base Attack hits, he’ll keep reaching the S Rank while collecting 9 AP, which is a good excuse to unleash one of Verso’s strong Light attacks. Finally, Verso must remain on S Rank to maximize the damage of each Burn DoT. However, if Verso’s Rank starts dropping, players can use Overload to fill his Rank and AP at the cost of losing his HP, which is not a big deal, since Verso can get the HP back immediately on the next Base Attack.

item.title: Genshin Impact: What To Expect From Nod-Krai
item.description:
Nod-Krai is a long-awaited sub-region of Genshin Impact ’s ever-elusive nation of Cryo. It’s officially considered to be autonomous from Snezhnaya and is known to be a place where different people from all over Teyvat gather. Genshin Impact players might recognize this region as something similar to Chenyu Vale in Liyue.

Nod-Krai has been mentioned quite a few times during the story, and its reputation precedes itself. Il Dottore, one of the Fatui Harbingers, is known to have a base there, and it also seems that Varka, the Grand Master of Mondstadt, will be investigating the region. Players can expect to see new NPCs, new environments, and new elements that even predate Teyvat. For those looking to find out more, here’s what to expect from Nod-Krai in Genshin Impact .

A More Substantial Story That Fills In The Gaps

A lot of Genshin Impact players may deem this patch as a ‘filler,’ but Nod-Krai’s purpose is to bridge the gaps that many players find within the story. Although the game includes most of the plot through the Archon Story, a chunk of it is also divided amongst side quests, world quests, and NPC interactions. However, there is another percentage of the game’s lore that is told through books collected and scripts found in the wild. It’s a fact that not all players may know or read these carefully hidden snippets, which is why the developers have decided to introduce Nod-Krai as that source of information.

Nod-Krai will essentially discuss most of the missing lore (that was already addressed in the books) and make it easier for players to understand the world of Teyvat before they reach Snezhnaya. Snezhnaya is the supposed ‘finale’ of the story, but it is imperative that we understand all these little plotlines so that it won’t be confusing when Snezhnaya finally unearths all the mysteries of the world. It will basically provide context to the situation and the many factors leading to the finale.

A Culmination Of All The Factions In Teyvat

From the Knights of Favonius and Aristocrats in Mondstadt to the Narzissenkreuz of Fontaine, Genshin Impact has come a long way in the number of factions Teyvat seemingly has. Each nation players have visited has introduced them to existing and old factions that not only add substance to the side plots of each nation but also contribute a great deal to the hidden lore that Travelers are trying to unravel. This hidden lore primarily pertains to Celestia's punishment on Teyvat and the Cataclysm that occured 500 years ago.

Since Snezhnaya is the last nation the Traveler will visit in Genshin Impact ’s story, it’s vital that the nation also gets its own share of factions. However, due to the eerie and mysterious nature that Nod-Krai brings to the story, the factions don’t fall short on their own hidden agendas. So far, most of the factions previously introduced have been quite tame in comparison, and this may be because Nod-Krai has a history that even predates the rise of the Seven. Some factions that players can look forward to meeting are:

  • Frostmoon Scions
  • The Lightkeepers
  • The Voynich Guild
  • The Wild Hunt
  • The Snowland Fae
  • The Hexenzirkel

The City Where All Elements Converge

Expanding on Nod-Krai’s ancient existence, it seems that this autonomous nation worships its own God and not the Archons. To be more specific, the area puts a lot of significance into anything related to the “Moon.”

Now, many Genshin Impact players who are locked into the lore of the game may recognize how important the Moon is in the story. There has been much foreshadowing surrounding it, and it all starts from Mondstadt, going all the way to Natlan’s Archon story, where players witness a shattered sky and a broken Moon in the distance. This is where the Song of the Welkin Moon comes in.

More Focus On Representation Of The Moon

The Song of the Welkin Moon essentially relates to the name of the Version that Nod-Krai comes under. This version update will last for 1 year, and in that time, the game will address all the plot holes and fill in any gaps with additional information. What we know so far is that Teyvat once had three Moons, and it has been speculated that these Moons were in fact Goddesses. There are many stories hidden in artifact pieces and books which speak of these Goddesses who once ruled Teyvat and held the purest form of primordial power. Primordial power is a plot point that has been mentioned since Fontaine’s arc. It has also been made clear that Dragon Sovereigns (Neuvillette) also have primordial power, but it has not been confirmed yet on whether the Moon’s primordial power is stronger.

As Nod-Krai’s ancient civilization places significance on the Moon Goddesses (similar to the citizens of Enkanomiya with their deity), their faction, the Frostmoon Scions, live in seclusion and are often at ends with the other factions due to their eccentric beliefs. We can expect to see coverage of the reason behind the death of the two Moons, Celestia’s wrongful punishment against Teyvat, and perhaps the reason why the Tsaritsa is going against the Primordial One. If players want to familiarize themselves with the significance of the Moon in Genshin Impact , they should head to Enkanomiya and read the “Before Sun and Moon” book series and study the murals in Ochkanatlan and Tsurumi Island.

Additionally, since the Moon’s power in Nod-Krai is at its highest, the area is a hot bed for criminals and factions looking to make it their own. This leads back to the factions and the huge significance they will bring to the plot.

Varka And Dottore’s Appearance

Dottore’s appearance was confirmed by Mavuika during the epilogue of Natlan’s Archon Quest. She mentioned to the Traveler that Nod-Krai was seemingly overrun by the Fatui, and they had plans to overthrow the citizens and take the land for themselves. There is speculation that Dottore once used a plot of land in Nod-Krai to conduct experiments but left for a bit due to failing results. On the other hand, there are some artifact pieces which state that Dottore conducts his research solely in Nod-Krai due to the power residing there, and he plans to take over the region under the Tsaritsa's orders. His presence has caused some problems, and this may also be one of the reasons why Grand Master Varka decided to head to Nod-Krai as well.

Varka is a name that has been mentioned throughout the Traveler’s journey through Teyvat, and it’s only now that they finally get to meet this ‘friend’ from afar. The Grand Master of Mondstadt, Varka is considered to be one of the strongest fighters they have and a cut above the rest. He actually left on an expedition six months prior to when the Traveler landed in Teyvat and took 80% of Mondstadt’s armed forces with him. Some reckon it was a hasty decision, whereas others believe it was a necessary move the Grand Master had to make. Genshin Impact players got confirmation of his whereabouts after meeting Mika, who was also on the expedition with Varka. Mika confirmed that Varka and he had met Capitano, before Mika was sent back and Varka chose to head towards a lead they found near Natlan.

This was eventually confirmed to be Nod-Krai, and Varka’s presence in the land is to do with the ancient power that resides there. The community is yet to find out whether Varka will be playing a hand in protecting this ancient power of the moon or using it to fuel his own personal plans related to the expedition. One can only wait to find out.

Nod-Krai is just around the corner, and it’s safe to say Genshin Impact has left some hidden messages for its arrival. The developers have stated that it will release as soon as Version 5.8 wraps up, and one of the livestream codes teased that Version 6.0 and Nod-Krai will drop on September 10, 2025 .
